Choose either plasmalyte or sodium chloride 0.9%

In the setting of acute spinal cord injury, it is important to ensure adequate volume resuscitation to ensure replenishment of effective circulating fluid volume. 
Consider the impact of fluid choice on the potential to develop or mitigate cord edema. For this reason, isotonic solutions (plasmalyte and sodium chloride 0.9%) have been recommended as fluids options.
Consider targeting normal-to-higher serum Na levels (135 to 145 mmol/L)
